newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech Tabak 96 gross div falls.
newsitem.headline: Czech Tabak 96 gross div falls.

text.p: Czech cigarette maker Tabak a.s. , a unit of Philip Morris Cos Inc, said on Friday it would pay a gross dividend of 580 crowns per share for 1996, after paying 656 crowns the previous year.
Tabak spokeswoman Dagmar Staroveska told Reuters shareholders of the firm on Friday approved the payout.
Tabak posted a 1996 net profit of 1.6 billion crowns, down slightly from 1.81 billion in 1995.
Tabak's revenues from sales of manufactured products totalled 8.92 billion crowns last year, up from 8.77 billion in 1995.
Tabak is estimated to hold a 75 percent market share in the country.
